definitions: fortified prison in Paris stormed during the French Revolution on July 14, 1789
any symbol of tyranny, oppression, or unjust imprisonment that needs to be overthrown
examples: The Bastille housed political prisoners before the revolutionary mob stormed it
France celebrates Bastille Day every July fourteenth with parades and fireworks
The old regime became a bastille that citizens eventually demolished
Activists viewed the corrupt system as their generation's bastille

definitions: water prepared for immersing the body for cleaning or relaxation
large container or tub designed to hold water for washing the body
act or instance of washing oneself in water
room containing a bathtub or shower used for washing
examples: She drew a hot bath with lavender essential oils
The baby splashed happily in the warm bath water
The Victorian clawfoot bath dominated the renovated bathroom
They installed a new porcelain bath during the remodel
The doctor recommended taking salt baths for muscle relief
After hiking, nothing beats a long relaxing bath
The master bedroom has an ensuite bath with marble fixtures
Please use the upstairs bath while we renovate downstairs

definitions: large semiaquatic rodent with broad flat tail that builds dams
soft brown fur from beaver animals used in making hats and clothing
person who works extremely hard and industriously at tasks
examples: The beaver constructed an impressive dam across the creek
North American beavers can weigh up to sixty pounds
Trappers sought beaver pelts during the fur trade era
His grandfather's beaver coat lasted for three decades
She's a real beaver when deadline season approaches
The team worked like beavers to finish the project

definitions: scene of wild uproar, confusion, and chaotic noise
historical psychiatric hospital in London, originally named Bethlem Royal Hospital
examples: The classroom erupted into complete bedlam when the fire alarm malfunctioned
Holiday shopping creates absolute bedlam at the mall
Bedlam became notorious for its cruel treatment of patients
Victorian tourists would pay to observe inmates at Bedlam

definitions: member of nomadic Arab peoples traditionally living in Middle Eastern and North African deserts
examples: The Bedouin guide led tourists through the Sahara Desert
Traditional Bedouin hospitality includes serving coffee to guests

definitions: Ludwig van Beethoven, influential German composer and pianist of the Classical and Romantic eras
examples: Beethoven composed his Ninth Symphony while completely deaf
The orchestra performed Beethoven's Fifth Symphony to standing ovations

definitions: hollow metal device that produces ringing sound when struck
anything shaped like a bell with wide bottom narrowing toward top
device used to signal time, warnings, or summon people
examples: The church bell rang every hour throughout the day
Bronze bells produce richer tones than steel ones
The trumpet's bell amplifies and projects the sound forward
Her dress had bell sleeves that flared at the wrists
The school bell signals the start of each class period
Ships use fog bells to warn other vessels nearby

definitions: long seat for multiple people, typically made of wood or metal
sturdy table used for manual work or crafts
seat where judges sit in a courtroom
area where substitute players sit during sports games
examples: They sat on the park bench feeding pigeons
The old wooden bench could seat four people comfortably
His workshop bench held all his woodworking tools
She assembled the electronics on her workbench
The judge returned to the bench after the recess
Three justices on the bench heard the appeal
The coach kept his best scorer on the bench
Players cheered from the bench throughout the game

definitions: curve or angle in something normally straight like a road or river
type of knot used to join two rope ends together
painful condition caused by nitrogen bubbles forming in blood during rapid decompression
examples: The accident happened at a sharp bend in the mountain road
The river makes a horseshoe bend around the peninsula
Sailors use a sheet bend to connect ropes of different thickness
The fisherman's bend secures the line to the anchor
Deep sea divers risk getting the bends from ascending too quickly
The bends can cause severe joint pain and paralysis

definitions: member of the Christian monastic order following the Rule of Saint Benedict
sweet herbal liqueur originally made by Benedictine monks in France
examples: The Benedictine monks maintain a vow of stability to their monastery
Benedictine sisters run the school attached to the abbey
He ordered Benedictine and brandy as an after-dinner digestif
The bartender used Benedictine in the classic cocktail recipe

definitions: economic union of Belgium, Netherlands, and Luxembourg formed to promote free trade
examples: Benelux countries coordinate their economic and trade policies closely
The Benelux union preceded the formation of the European Union

definitions: region in South Asia comprising Bangladesh and the Indian state of West Bengal
subspecies of tiger native to the Indian subcontinent
domestic cat breed with wild appearance and spotted or marbled coat patterns
examples: The Bengal region has a rich cultural and literary heritage
Bengal was partitioned during Indian independence in 1947
The Royal Bengal tiger is India's national animal
Bengal tigers are the most numerous tiger subspecies
Their Bengal cat has beautiful rosette markings like a leopard
Bengal cats are known for their energetic and playful nature

definitions: Indo-Aryan ethnic group native to the Bengal region
Indo-Aryan language spoken in Bangladesh and West Bengal
person from Bengal or of Bengali descent
examples: Bengali culture emphasizes literature, music, and art
The Bengali community celebrates Durga Puja with great enthusiasm
She's learning Bengali to communicate with her grandmother
Bengali uses its own distinct script derived from Brahmi
My Bengali colleagues invited me to their cultural festival
The Bengali chef specializes in traditional fish curries

definitions: major seaport city in Washington state, known for technology companies and coffee culture
examples: Seattle hosts the headquarters of Amazon and Microsoft
The Space Needle has become Seattle's most iconic landmark

definitions: formal withdrawal from membership in a political union, federation, or religious organization
examples: The Southern states' secession led to the American Civil War
Several members threatened secession from the trade union over policy disputes

definitions: administrative department or office responsible for secretarial and clerical work
department of the United Nations headed by the Secretary-General
legendary American thoroughbred racehorse who won the Triple Crown in 1973
examples: The secretariat handles all correspondence for the organization
She works in the secretariat preparing meeting minutes and reports
The UN Secretariat coordinates peacekeeping operations worldwide
Kofi Annan led the United Nations Secretariat from 1997 to 2006
Secretariat won the Belmont Stakes by an incredible thirty-one lengths
Many consider Secretariat the greatest racehorse of all time

definitions: Jewish ritual feast marking the beginning of Passover, commemorating the Exodus from Egypt
examples: The family gathered for the Passover seder at grandmother's house
During the seder, they read from the Haggadah and ate symbolic foods

definitions: Native American people originally from Florida, now also in Oklahoma
examples: The Seminole tribe successfully resisted removal to Indian Territory
Seminole culture blends Creek, African American, and Spanish influences

definitions: member of peoples speaking Semitic languages, including Arabs, Jews, and ancient Assyrians
examples: Ancient Semites developed some of the world's earliest writing systems
The term Semite derives from Shem, Noah's son in biblical tradition

definitions: family of languages including Arabic, Hebrew, Aramaic, and Amharic
relating to the Semitic peoples or their languages and cultures
examples: Semitic languages share similar grammatical structures and root systems
Arabic is the most widely spoken Semitic language today
Semitic cultures have profoundly influenced world religions and philosophy
The museum features ancient Semitic inscriptions and artifacts

definitions: upper house of a bicameral legislature in many democratic countries
governing body of certain universities responsible for academic matters
examples: The Senate must approve all federal judicial nominations
Each state elects two senators to the United States Senate
The university senate voted to revise the graduation requirements
Faculty representatives serve three-year terms on the academic senate

definitions: Native American nation of the Iroquois Confederacy in New York state
Lucius Annaeus Seneca, Roman Stoic philosopher and statesman
examples: The Seneca Nation operates several casinos in western New York
Seneca warriors played crucial roles in the French and Indian War
Seneca's letters provide insights into Stoic philosophy and Roman life
Emperor Nero forced Seneca to commit suicide in 65 CE

definitions: country in West Africa on the Atlantic coast, capital city Dakar
examples: Senegal gained independence from France in 1960
Dakar serves as Senegal's capital and largest city

definitions: native or inhabitant of Senegal
relating to Senegal, its people, culture, or languages
examples: The Senegalese artist exhibited her work internationally
Many Senegalese speak both French and Wolof fluently
Senegalese cuisine features rice, fish, and peanut-based sauces
The Senegalese government promotes sustainable fishing practices

definitions: Spanish title of respect for a man, equivalent to Mister or Sir
examples: Senor Martinez manages the hotel in Barcelona
The waiter addressed him politely as senor

definitions: Spanish title of respect for a married woman, equivalent to Mrs. or Madam
examples: Senora Rodriguez teaches Spanish literature at the university
The shop owner greeted her customer as senora

definitions: capital and largest city of South Korea, major global financial and technology center
examples: Seoul hosts headquarters of Samsung and LG Electronics
The Seoul subway system ranks among the world's busiest

definitions: Jew of Spanish, Portuguese, North African, or Middle Eastern descent, distinct from Ashkenazi
examples: Sephardi traditions include unique liturgical melodies and customs
Many Sephardi Jews settled in Ottoman lands after the Spanish expulsion

definitions: reddish-brown pigment originally obtained from cuttlefish ink
brownish tint used in photography to give an antique appearance
genus of cuttlefish that produces dark brown ink
examples: Artists prized sepia ink for its warm brown tones
The old master drawings were executed in sepia wash
Wedding photographers often use sepia tones for vintage effects
The sepia photographs evoked nostalgia for the Victorian era
The sepia released ink to escape from the predator
Mediterranean sepia are harvested for both food and ink

definitions: ninth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, having thirty days
examples: School typically starts in September after summer vacation
September marks the beginning of autumn in the Northern Hemisphere

definitions: native or inhabitant of Serbia or person of Serbian descent
examples: Many Serbs emigrated during the Yugoslav wars
The Serb community celebrates their patron saint's day

definitions: landlocked country in Southeast Europe in the central Balkans
examples: Serbia declared independence from Yugoslavia in 2006
Belgrade serves as Serbia's capital and largest city

definitions: relating to Serbia, its people, or their culture
South Slavic language spoken primarily in Serbia, Bosnia, and Montenegro
examples: Serbian Orthodox churches feature distinctive Byzantine architecture
The Serbian government implemented economic reforms
She's studying Serbian to communicate with her relatives
Serbian uses both Cyrillic and Latin alphabets

definitions: vast ecosystem in Tanzania and Kenya known for annual wildlife migrations
examples: The Serengeti hosts the world's largest terrestrial mammal migration
Wildebeest cross the Serengeti plains during their annual journey

definitions: action of helping or doing work for someone
routine maintenance and repair of equipment or vehicles
formal religious ceremony or meeting for worship
period of duty in the armed forces
system for serving food or providing utilities
examples: Customer service representatives handle complaints and inquiries
The hotel prides itself on excellent service
The car needs its annual service and inspection
Regular service extends the lifespan of machinery
Sunday service begins at ten o'clock sharp
The memorial service honored fallen soldiers
He completed his military service in the Marines
Mandatory service lasts two years in some countries
Room service delivers meals directly to hotel guests
The postal service operates six days per week

definitions: group of similar things that belong together or are used together
scenery and props arranged on stage for theatrical production
group of games forming unit of scoring in tennis match
collection of distinct mathematical objects considered as a whole
examples: She bought a complete set of china for twelve
The tool set includes everything needed for basic repairs
The crew changed the set between acts of the play
Film sets recreate historical periods with amazing detail
He won the match in straight sets without dropping one
The final set went to a tiebreaker
The set of prime numbers is infinite
Students learned about intersection and union of sets

definitions: person who maintains church property and assists with burials and bell-ringing
examples: The sexton prepared the church for Sunday services
Our sexton rings the bells every hour during daylight

definitions: title of the former hereditary monarch of Iran and some other Eastern countries
examples: The last Shah of Iran fled during the 1979 revolution
Shah Abbas I expanded the Persian Empire significantly

definitions: container with perforated top for sprinkling or mixing ingredients
member of Christian religious sect known for celibacy and simple living
device that shakes or vibrates for mixing or separating materials
examples: The bartender used a cocktail shaker to mix the martini
Pass the salt shaker, please
Shaker furniture exemplifies simple, functional design
The Shaker community practiced gender equality
The paint shaker ensures thorough mixing of pigments
Laboratory shakers agitate samples at controlled speeds

definitions: William Shakespeare, renowned English playwright and poet of the Elizabethan era
examples: Shakespeare wrote thirty-seven plays and 154 sonnets
Students study Shakespeare's tragedies in literature class

definitions: characteristic of or relating to William Shakespeare's works, style, or era
examples: The actor specialized in Shakespearean roles like Hamlet
Shakespearean sonnets follow a specific rhyme scheme

definitions: major port city and financial center on China's eastern coast
practice of forcibly recruiting sailors by drugging or kidnapping
examples: Shanghai ranks as China's most populous city
The Shanghai Stock Exchange drives Asian financial markets
Sailors feared being shanghaied in notorious port districts
The crimps would shanghai drunk men onto departing ships

definitions: Algonquian-speaking Native American people originally from the Ohio Valley
examples: The Shawnee leader Tecumseh formed a confederacy against American expansion
Shawnee traditions include the Green Corn ceremony

definitions: international hotel chain owned by Marriott International
neoclassical furniture style from late eighteenth-century England
examples: They booked a conference room at the downtown Sheraton
Sheraton hotels operate in over seventy countries
The antique Sheraton sideboard features delicate inlay work
Sheraton furniture emphasizes straight lines and restraint

definitions: member of Himalayan people living in Nepal and Tibet, often serving as guides
expert mountaineer who assists climbers in high-altitude expeditions
examples: Sherpa culture centers around Buddhism and mountain life
The Sherpa community has lived in the Himalayas for centuries
Experienced sherpas guide expeditions up Mount Everest
The sherpa carried supplies to the base camp

definitions: archipelago in Scotland northeast of the Scottish mainland
small hardy pony breed originating from the Shetland Islands
fine wool from sheep raised in the Shetland Islands
examples: The Shetland Islands host spectacular seabird colonies
Oil discoveries transformed Shetland's economy
Children love riding the gentle Shetland ponies
Shetland ponies stand under 42 inches tall
She knitted a sweater from authentic Shetland wool
Shetland wool creates lightweight yet warm garments

definitions: one of two main branches of Islam, believing Ali was Muhammad's rightful successor
examples: Shia Muslims commemorate Ashura with processions and mourning rituals
Iran has the world's largest Shia Muslim population

definitions: adherent of the Shia branch of Islam
examples: Shiite pilgrims visit holy shrines in Karbala and Najaf
The Shiite cleric delivered Friday prayers at the mosque

definitions: indigenous religion of Japan emphasizing nature worship and ancestral veneration
examples: Shinto shrines feature distinctive torii gates at their entrances
Many Japanese practice both Shinto and Buddhist traditions

definitions: major Hindu deity known as the destroyer and transformer in the Trimurti
seven-day Jewish mourning period observed after a close relative's death
examples: Devotees worship Shiva at temples throughout India
Shiva's cosmic dance represents creation and destruction cycles
The family sat shiva for their grandmother last week
During shiva, mourners receive visitors at home
